thread.title: German Steel Town Fears U.S. Tariffs Would Deal Crushing Blow

author: Zeke Turner
title: German Steel Town Fears U.S. Tariffs Would Deal Crushing Blow
text:
BRANDENBURG AN DER HAVEL, Germany—The steel mill in this Gothic town one hour southwest of Berlin has long supplied Europe, its main market, with wire used in construction. But it could still become a casualty of new U.S. tariffs on steel imports.
That is because the tariffs, announced last month, are threatening to redirect to Europe a wave of cheap steel from countries that had previously exported the alloy to America. Not long after President Donald Trump announced the 25% tariff on steel imports, Brandenburg’s steel mill... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
